Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2010 06:23AM tropicmom wrote: Back again!  Things are starting to look clearer. I had to reade some posts 3 or 4 times, but I'm starting to get it.  I just found out I have about 45 leave days I can take to offset some of the 60 waiting period for std!  whew!  I have an appt with the state admin of std/ltd plan, but until then I have some more questions Does this mean if I earn say 100$ on STD I can make up to  100$ more before they reduce benefits?  "Earnings are permitted during the short-term disability period not to exceed the amount of the short-term benefit without causing a reduction in your benefit amount. If your earnings exceed the amount of the short-term benefit, your short-term benefit will be reduced on a dollar-for-dollar basis." AND: Does this mean I can get the 60% LTD and earn up to whatever I was making at my job before I went on disability? In other words, the 40%? So If I was making 40,000,LTD would give me 24000, and I could earn up to 16000$, and be ok? "Earnings do not affect the amount of your longterm disability benefit if you do not exceed the amount of the difference between your monthly net long-term disability benefit and the monthly compensation you were earning when you became disabled. If your monthly earnings exceed this difference, your monthly long-term benefit will"
Posts.Title: Money and Newbies - SSDI, STD, LTD and Life Insurance... Lowrider54 Chickadee

Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2010 10:19AM - edited Sep 5, 2010 10:22AM by tropicmom Question about your experiences with STD and LTD from employer.  I posted it on the wrong thread, I think.  Trying here.  I was so hoping to avoid this but here goes: I am getting ready to apply for STD/LTD from my employerr. Since they offer it, I'm going to take it and then go for the SSD. Mainly b/c I will get a little more $ and get to stay on health insurance for a bit.  I know most companies are different in how to qualify, but want to hear your experiences in getting approved for the STD/LTD.  I was dx Stage IV in Jan 07. I was NED by Sept 07, with localized recurrence May 10. I think I am still Stage IV (? will check with doc) I know that SSD gives automatic acceptance for StageIV.  Do most  STD/LTD plans do the same?  I have been working since dx, but since this last recurrence and reconstruction process, I am mentally/psychologically starting to feel  beat down and ready to stop and concentrate on getting well.  Truthfully, I think the stress of the past year at work is what brought on the the recurrence. We returned to school this month (I am a teacher)  And the stress is knocking me off my feet daily., I looked at the form that goes to the doc.  One of the questions asks if the pt is able to perform the duties of her employment.  Technically, I guess that would be a yes.  I can walk and talk and write. Do you think that would be an issue? The only tx I'm on now is herceptin and tamoxifen. Thanks for your help.
Posts.Title: Money and Newbies - SSDI, STD, LTD and Life Insurance... Lowrider54 Chickadee

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2010 01:24PM tropicmom wrote: Thanks, Lr.  This was very helpful, and relieving. I jsut saw doc today and she agreed I should be on STD, at least.  I didn't realize I could do SSD and LTD.  That would be great since my SSD is much less than what I'm making now.  And I was also worried about what to do for the "lead time' that SSA takes to start sending checks. Another concern of course, is the medical insurance. If I am on STD/LTD, I keep my employer insurance instead of having to wait 24 mos for medicare.  This is very concerning since I am in the middle of reconstruction and still in tx. Thanks again.  I think things are beginning to fall into place.
Posts.Title: Money and Newbies - SSDI, STD, LTD and Life Insurance... Lowrider54 Chickadee

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2008 05:44PM tropicmom wrote: I have never used anything. They don't even offer it at the hospital where I go. It really doesn't hurt much, or for long. Less, actually then a shot.
Posts.Title: Numbing Spray for Port Banned by Joint Commission TripleNeg LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2009 09:52AM tropicmom wrote: Hi Marsha.  I started the Feb  chemo cruise with you all. I was dx with mets right after original dx, and didn't post much on that board. But, I checked in on you all a couple times a day. I followed your ups and downs, chemo difficulties, hair loss and return. I went with the girls in spirit to visit Florida and saw your Patsy Cline show in my imagination. (BTW, I'm an old theater girl myself- theater degree from FAU) So I still feel a part of the Feb 2007 group. My original dx was mets to liver. I started weekly chemo (navelbine and herceptin) in Feb.  6 week scan showed considerable reduction and by August, I was dancing with NED! Even the onc was surprised. We stopped navelbine in September and had herceptin every three weeks. This past August onc decided I didn't even need herceptin, so I only go back every three months for scans. Just had   scans in November and I am still NED. Onc even used the word "remission" She said I could be in remission for quite some time.  I have just had my 2 year cancerversary, and plan to have many more. And I truly believe it will be the same for you. You are so positive and upbeat I see no other path for you T
Posts.Title: PET/CT shows bone and liver mets marshakb nancyc

Posts.Content: tropicmom wrote: I'm so upset, even though I know that they seem to turn everyone down almost automatically... no matter what. I'm stage IV NED with a recurrence three years after original dx of Stage IV.  I'm also 58 years old, which I thought was supposed to be a considering factor. I'm just disgusted. I am almost positive that the stress of my job brought about the recurrence. And during one of the reconstruction surgeries, my lung was punctured and I had to stay in the hospital. for 4 days instead of 4 hours.     Can you say traumatized.  I've been out of work on prelimnary long term disability for a year, but now that is gone. My doc won't check the box that says I'm unable to work and am permanently disabled, so HR thinks I wont get permanent long term from the private insurance either.. And I have to most likely wait upt to 45 days for their decision . So no money, and no insurance. No tamoxifen, no anti anxiety meds. Not seeing a lot of jobs in this economy either. hmmm. Thanks for listening all. Dx 1/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: SS turned me down tropicmom Chickadee

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2012 10:25PM tropicmom wrote: Thanks, everyone. It's nice to see responses. I guess I was kind of confusing. I was talking about two different 'disabilities' insurance.  The LTD is the more difficult one, and less likely. We turned in the paperwork for Perm LTD, but it will take 45 days or so to process. Not counting on that one, but fingers crossed.  Espcially for medical coverage. I just got my letter from SS today, saying that I do not qualify for SSDI. But that I can appeal. But SSDI should not be an issue, I think. And EnglishMajor is correct, that does not require a doctor's sign off. Mets to liver sound like distant metastasies to me. No?  I guess I shall have to get an attorney to  appeal. Ridiculous as it is.   And like I said, I know that in general, they turn everyone down on first appl. One can't help but wonder how much 'collusion' with attorneys is occurring.

Like I said, I'm 57, and supposedly, they take age into consideration for determination. I will talk to our 'association" rep, about the ltd. I totally forgot they have someone who might be able to help

Posts.Title: Scans Today LuAnnH heatherpalmerton

Posts.Content: tropicmom wrote: Had my scans last week. Report says: organs clear/no evidence of disease!!! I'm so excited.  Onc even used the "r" word. Says with my great response, and what I am doing, I could be in remission for several years.!!  Wow. Recap: I was dx in January with a small (2cm) lump, next week found 2 small(2cm) mets to liver. Lumpectomy then started on Navelbine and herceptin WEEKLY! Doc wanted to hit hard and fast. Subsequent 3 month and then six month scans showed continuing shrinkage of lesions and by August I was off Navelbine and onto herceptin every  3 weeks  and tamoxifen. Last little lesion was not measurable. And the last scan now shows NED I swear, I think he had me dying when he first met me.  Said: "oh liver mets are pretty bad..." I never quit working, chemo wasn't too bad, even infusion was pretty short (comparatively). I kept exercising at least 4 times a week with aerobics and walking. Also tookVit D, astralagus, along with heavy B vitamins. Accupuncture for some immune and side effects. I am still on tamoxifen and will be on herceptin"for as long as it works". Cause we don't trust this disease.. Dx 1/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Dancing with NED!!! tropicmom ozzie2

Posts.Content: tropicmom wrote:  http://www.wral.com/news/local/story/3549530/ This woman claimed to have bc, then claimed her husband divorced her and cancelled her insurance so she couldn't get treatment. This group held several fundraisers and donated their own cash to her. Then she claimed she had mets and couldn't get tx. The group had several more fundraisers, set up on line accounts to collect donations. Then she claimed she had a fire and lost everything. Then she claimed she had bone mets in her jaw and couldn't talk or eat, and medicare would not give her surgery to fix it. Soon after that she claimed her son had been killed in Iraq. This has been terrible, long nightmare with this woman. Who not only got monetary support every time she cried out, but emotional, as well. I have to say, I started to get suspicious when one thing after another happened to her. When she  was unable to take advantage of all the suggestions we tried to giver her. I found out so much helpful information from these boards, especially this one, and tried to pass  on the wonderful information I got here. But there was always some excuse why it wouldn't work for her. The group began to get really suspicious and someone started probing a little too deeply, and she disappeared. She was reported to the police, and lo and behold, a scammer appeared. I am proud to be member of the support group that worked so hard to help this woman, and hope that her behavior does not damage those of us with this truely wicked disease. We have all tried to move on and not be bitter, but I am still a little angry that someone could be so malicious. This (arrest warrant) has been in the works for quite some time and I really wanted to get it off my chest here,but was told to hold off in case she was a member of the discussion groups.  After all, if one is going to pretend to have cancer, what better place to come to for information. Thanks for letting me air my small vent. Dx 1/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Scammer uses cancer for cash tropicmom pinoideae

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2008 07:49PM tropicmom wrote: I have a power port, it has been wonderful to use over my 18 months of infusions.  I was told we can use it for the CT"s, but not the MUGA or bone.  I used it one time for the ct then just let them use my arm. The deal is that a nurse does have to access the port, they have to flush it with about a gallon of saline , draw some blood, then draw some more. Then after, they have to flush again and put in some heparin. Sometimes also have to wait for a nurse. All that takes longer than the damn scan so I just go with the arm which is an easy stick. I am at a hospital clinic, so I see the doc every other time I went for infusions. The nurse would access the port and do the blood for labs, leave it accessed and when I went upstairs after seeing the onc, I was ready to go for chemo.
Posts.Title: ports AliceJean tropicmom

Posts.Content: tropicmom wrote: Hey all. Had my 3rd ct today. After 12 almost weeklly rounds of navelbine and herceptin. Last scan 3 mos ago showed no new spots and two liver spots reduced more than 50% to sub centimeter size. Doc is planning on stopping the navelbine. YAY! and starting tamoxifen and continuing on every 3 week herceptin. YAY! Of course, I'm sure this latest scan will show nothing anywhere!! Will know for sure tomorrow. Question, though, since I got back from scan, I have had mild diarhea, and nausea. Wondring if it is from the contrast. Never had this the other two times. Anyone experience this? I have just finshed two weeks off chemo and herct Dx 1/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: CT scans today and question tropicmom simeon

Posts.Content: tropicmom wrote: Afer being off chemo (navelbine) for almost 2 years and off herceptin for almost1. I have had wonderfully clean scans until last week.  The good news is, that ct showed that my innards are all still clear. Liver has been clear for 2 years now! Bone scan shows uptake in sternum and one rib and skull. (!!) I had a car accident right before my scans in March, and there was considerable trauma to ribs and sternum from seat belt and air bag. And it showed up in the bone scan. Doc was a little concerned until we talked more about the accident. But she upped the date of the next scans.I don't have my appt with doc until tomorrow, but she always calls me when she gets the results the next day This scan showed uptake in the same spot as before, just not as widespread.. Doc thinks it should be more healed and not showing so much uptake, if it is just trauma from the accident..     She is also concerned about the uptake in the skull. Before my appointment tomorrow, I am getting an xray of, I guess, my skull and chest to better see what's going on.  Ugh, I feel that it's probably nothing, most of the time. At least, better not to worry till after xray. Then will it be biopsy? Do they bx bone mets? Back on herceptin?  Back on navelbine? Bx of my skull?  Yikes. How do they do that?  I'm having no pain in any of those places, btw. Can you have arthritis of the skull?  lol  Well I guess we will talk tomorrow. Dx 1/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 3 month scans tropicmom raro

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2008 07:58PM tropicmom wrote: I forgot, this week's trip to the onc, when the nurse accessed my port, she couldn't get blood return for the first time ever. She ordered some TAP(?) and injected it into the port. I had to sit about 30 minutes and voila-blood! She said sometimes scar tissue forms in the port that doesn't get cleaned by the heparin. But that the TAP almost always works. It's a common thing according to nurse.
Posts.Title: ports AliceJean tropicmom

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2008 05:09AM tropicmom wrote: YIkes, you guys are scaring me now.  My doc just took me off herceptin. After being NED for a year. She took quite a while deciding whether to do it and we discussed it.She seemed to think it was ok. And I am surely enjoying not having to go there every three weeks. They seem to think I am unusual in that I had mets (liver) and they went completely away and pretty quickly as well. I didn't blithely make the decision, but was feeling pretty good about it.  Although it is in the back of my mind all the time.. Course, it's only been a week since we decided.  We will still do scans every three months. Well, we'll see. I am so thankfull that we have a place to share all this.
Posts.Title: HER2 + Gals - a Question mthomp2020 mthomp2020

Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2008 12:59AM tropicmom wrote: I had one in Jan 07.  The doc used ultrasound to locate the lesion. And some kind of needle. They also started an IV for mild sedation. I don't reallly remember feeling the sedation, but I was not uncomfortable. The actually puncture barely hurt, but it was really interesting to feel it when he poked the liver. It didn't really hurt, but I could a feel a POP. Weird. I think I even said that out loud. OOh that was weird. Since I had the sedation, I couldn't eat breakfast, but Ihad to have  a friend come with me and she went out and got me some lunch.  I was Starving!! We ate in the recovery room. I wasn't even really lying on my side the whole time. I felt fine and all I wanted was to go home. My friend had to get her kids from school too. No one told me I had to stay so long. I was mad, I wouldn't have imposed a whole damn day at the hospital on my poor friend. I finally nagged them so much, they let us go at around 3:30. I was fine the next day. No pain at all, and did my regular walking and eating and shopping. You will do great, liver will be fine I just know it.
Posts.Title: Liver Biopsy - What To Expect KellyC KellyC
